item.description:

item.title: By: Ariel Cohen
item.dc:creator: Ariel Cohen
item.description: I disagree with your comment "expecting a home user to be constantly connected ". In the US it is very obvious that this is the case. When I came here I was very surprised that I had to log in every time when using ADSL. But I found out that there is a way to hack the modem and turn it to be a router thus it always on. I think that bezeq don't give it as a default in order to make it harder for users to set a wireless connection at home, unless buying the router from bezeq.
